result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawndell L. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawndell L. Smith

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on February 12, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: defendant called and stated will be in this Friday, July 14th to make payment - employment check did not come in as scheduled

defendant appears in person - court questions - states has done 6 hours so far at Food Pantry and YMCA.  Court questions further - states has a job now - got it about 2 months ago.  Court questions further - court states will add all cases to payment plan and NOTES will still take Community Service hours too.  Court explains to defendant - to do both - pay and do Community Service

11:46 a.m. Defendant Shawndell L. Smith in court.  Defendant has not done any community service hours; Goodwill called last week Thursday - has an interview today at 3:00 - all other places have denied his application. Defendant needs to do 20 hours community service as part of his sentence. Court approves community service at rate of $10 per hour; in addition Court approves $50/monthly payment. Court notes pending cases and possibility of more fines. Court expects some payment on fine due to defendant's promotion. Court schedules review hearing March 7, 2017 at 10:00 to review community service as part of sentence. Adj. 11:52 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
From defendant requesting an extension on CS.  Informed he should attend RH and explain his situaiton to the judge.

11;00 a.m. Defendant does not appear. Attorney Rodman Wells Streicher in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm23 and 16fo56. Streicher statement that called Clerk's office and stated that work would not let him off for court appearance - was transferred to DA's office. 11:03 a.m. - Defendant now appears. State moves to dismiss 16fo56 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to 16cm23.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Streicher/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
Community Service - 20 hours 
Costs/DNA Surcharge
Court will allow community service for court costs.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Appeal rights given. 
Adj. 11:20 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 11:45 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on August 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

2:28 p.m. Defendant Shawndell L. Smith in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm23 and 16fo56. Rielly requests jury trial. Bail continued. Adj. 2:29 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

2:53 p.m. Defendant Shawndell L. Smith in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:54 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

1:21 p.m. Defendant Shawndell L. Smith in court via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 16cm23 and 16fo56.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond. Adj. 1:24 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
